oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of female employees of the DuPont plant
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Black and white photograph of about 28 women who worked at the DuPont plant. All are dressed in similar mid-calf length dresses and have relaltively short hair. Hand written on the back "women who worked at the plant." Believed to date from late 1920s, although the ivy growing on the building may be an indicator of a later date. DuPont constructed the Old Hickory Powder Plant on contract with the Army during WWI. In 1928, DuPont returned to Old Hickory and began making Rayon, Remay, and Cellophane.
